abstract: French police reports reveal that terrorists who carried out November attack in Paris attack contacted at least one person in Belgium by cellphone while events were taking place; reports raise questions about whether attacks were monitored or coordinated from abroad and raise possibility that breadth of attackers' network was wider than previously assumed; findings undermine belief that Abdelhamd Abaaoud, involved in attacks, was not main strategist but instead was reporting back to others in higher positions.
lead_paragraph: Police reports that assailants in Paris were in cellphone contact with at least one person in Belgium during the attacks challenge the assumption that one of them was the chief planner.

headline.main: Cellphone Contacts in Paris Attacks Suggest Foreign Coordination
headline.print_headline: Cellphone Contacts in Paris Attacks Suggest Coordination From Abroad

snippet: Police reports that assailants in Paris were in cellphone contact with at least one person in Belgium during the attacks challenge the assumption that one of them was the chief planner.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
